channel.title: It on Bobby World
channel.description: Recent content in It on Bobby World

item.title: Rise of browser based app
item.description:
The release of atom Editor and followed with the release of facebook’s Nuclide and also the new Visual Studio Code made me think that Browser based app is a very powerful platform, who knows maybe next time a true native office suite app, or a multimedia app could build based on that, since Nuclide and Visual Studio Code is an IDE that have tons of functionality.

The framework that is used to build those Apps is Electron and it is created by Github, based on the Github page for Electron: The Electron framework lets you write cross-platform desktop applications using JavaScript, HTML and CSS. It is based on io.js and Chromium.
